Replies.Author: Gene
Replies.Content:
Bungaku Shoujo movieâ€™s already on the hard drive. We have the 1080p version and weâ€™ll be showing it this coming semester. We only have two episodes of Memoir, and a quick google search tells me thatâ€™s all thatâ€™s available right now, so I wouldnâ€™t worry too much about not finding the last OVA.

Nyarlko isnâ€™t complete yet, but theyâ€™ve released something that looks like a [OP PV](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=imoWdOM6kQk) so far. Subbing is slow on the flash raws but theyâ€™re out there. Commie subbed one because theyâ€™re a bunch of trolls but hopefully theyâ€™ll release more as they become available.

I donâ€™t know enough about the game yet either, but there are rumors that besides whatever platform its on, itâ€™ll also see a release on the iphone/ipad (this is just a guess based on the fact that theyâ€™ve released a promotional app for free already). NICE BOAT END? DO WANT.

Donâ€™t forget the PFP on TWGOK, that made me laugh a bit.

We donâ€™t have Tamayura on the HD, but Iâ€™ll look into adding it here pretty soon. We have all 26 eps of To Love-Ru already, but not all 12 of Motto- downloaded yet. Maybe Iâ€™ll do it, I dunno. Not a big fan of the series (except Hanazawa-san is pretty great in episode 11 of Motto).

God Iâ€™d love to go to summer comiket. Great list for having stuff not on Chrisâ€™ or mine list. Despite saying youâ€™re not good at this sort of thing it was an enjoyable read, past the silly errors here and there. ğŸ™‚

Replies.Author: Chris
Replies.Content:
11? Heresy! \*conveniently ignoring the fact my lazy ass only had 7\*

Very interesting list-not only have I not seen a lot of it, I havenâ€™t even heard of some of it. I agree about depicting everyday life-I think itâ€™s important to watch shows like that, because it brings us back to earth and reminds us that amazing things happen in normal life, too.

Kuroneko beats Kirno anyday. I am completely in favor of a Kuroneko end. Angel Beats game? Sign me up, hopefully itâ€™s for the PC. Maybe I should look into learning Japaneseâ€¦

Lol at the amount of Hanazawa Kana-san, though Iâ€™m definitely not knocking you for it. Sheâ€™s an excellent VA, and sheâ€™s quickly becoming one of my favorites (not to mention she seems to be in everything lately).

As for your â€œmental illnessâ€â€¦I wouldnâ€™t call it an illness per se, just an, eh, infatuation. Itâ€™s perfectly fine to be a big fan of someone, but be careful about turning them into someone theyâ€™re not. Remember the idealized Hanazawa-san of your dreams is probably not the Hanazawa-san of reality. Ask yourself what it is, exactly, that draws you to her. If itâ€™s her skill as a seiyuu, or the characters she voices, I would advise you to separate those things from her actual persona (there are plenty of people I respect for their abilities that I would never want to eat lunch with). If itâ€™s her actual personality/appearance, there are plenty of other girls like her. Youâ€™ll find someone better, and closer to home; Iâ€™m sure of it.

Hope you have a great New Yearâ€™s (Iâ€™m getting my wisdom teeth pulled tomorrow, so Iâ€™ll probably spend it in pain T\_T). And if youâ€™re ever feeling down, weâ€™re here for you (I am, at least). If you need to talk, Iâ€™m all ears.

Replies.Author: Chaeha
Replies.Content:
The thing is, living in a dream kinda became part of my life already, to the point where I would actually call it an illness. Iâ€™ve been like that since when I was in elemantary school, or even before that. Itâ€™s not limited to this kind of symptoms either. Itâ€™s just that I always live in my own little world. This time it just happened to be meeting Hanazawa-san. Sometimes itâ€™s making so much money, winning something, and stuff like that.

I think Iâ€™m a little ill (Iâ€™m serious) but very little that Iâ€™m not classified as one. I think if it was a little more, theyâ€™d tell me Iâ€™m a bipolar. I get depressed for no reason, and next minute Iâ€™m happy for no reason. But itâ€™s okay, I guess. There are people worse than me, and Iâ€™m thankful that Iâ€™m not that bad. And Iâ€™ve lived like this so long, I think I made peace with this. Usually Iâ€™d write this in diary, but for some reason I left it on the Mines Park, and I hope no one reads it.

Also, thatâ€™s how I decided to become a writer. I donâ€™t know how this will sound, but I donâ€™t really write. Itâ€™s like Iâ€™m there, and I just record whatever I see. (Well, I _am_ there. Itâ€™s that I canâ€™t get out of it is the problem) I thought â€œitâ€™d be a waste if no one knew about the world Iâ€™m seeing right now.â€ you know. Whenever I close my eyes and concentrate, I can see it. Itâ€™s hard to explain, I guess.

Anyway, thanks to me who always escape reality to world I want, when I was, like, 4 or 5, I didnâ€™t like how one anime turned out to be. So I made it my own way, and I donâ€™t think I watched it much after that. It was not very different, but it was how I wanted it. Now I have my own characters, places, background story, and things like that. I guess not everything about my issue is bad. This also helped me distinguish between reality and fiction, despite what you may think. I myself donâ€™t know how or why, but it is true.

Oh, and my wisdom teeth are growing. I can see one of them poking out. I thought I could leave it alone if it doesnâ€™t hurt, but my mom said itâ€™s good idea to pull it out no matter what. I hope you are okay.

And thanks for worrying about me. I feel much better now, and Iâ€™m okay. Donâ€™t worry about me.

Replies.Author: Chris
Replies.Content:
Glad to hear youâ€™re doing okay. I think the best thing would be to keep doing what youâ€™re doing â€“ writing what you see and experience. And it sounds like something that would really help your ability as a writer. If I ever see a game with your name on it, Iâ€™ll learn whatever language itâ€™s in and buy it ^\_^

Got my teeth pulled this morning, and everything seems to have gone smoothly. Now I get to go through the awesomeness that is a liquid diet. Yogurt and dak-jook FTW @\_@

Replies.Author: digital boy
Replies.Content:
re: Tamayura \>\>Itâ€™s a three-episode OVA.

It was a four-episode OVA. Assuming you didnâ€™t make a typo, you should go find ep 4 :3

This is a lovely list, and Iâ€™m very happy to see someone who enjoyed Black Rock Shooter so much since it warranted a lot of unnecessary negative attention for no reason, in spite of being quite good. Iâ€™ve got it on DVD now thanks to it being thrown in with the BRS figma and nendoroid releases.

Iâ€™d reply further, but I have my own 2010 anime review to speak for me~

[http://myswordisunbelievablydull.wordpress.com/2010/12/30/2010-anime-review/](http://myswordisunbelievablydull.wordpress.com/2010/12/30/2010-anime-review/)

Replies.Author: Chaeha
Replies.Content: I thought it ended with 3 episodes. Thanks for telling me.
